document.masterDocTitle: A sea of worms: polychaete checklist of the Adriatic Sea

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A sea of worms: polychaete checklist of the Adriatic Sea

subSubSection.paragraph:
NEW
RECORDS
: BM 14 , BM 20 , BM 21 , BM 26 , BM 27 , BM 38 , BM 39 , BM 40 , BM 53 , BM 54 , BM 60 , BM 92 .
OTHER
REPORTED NAMES
:
Caulleriella caputesocis (Saint-Joseph, 1894 )
;
Heterocirrus caputesocis Saint-Joseph, 1894
.

NEW
RECORDS
: BM 11 , BM 13 , BM 16 , BM 21 , BM 22 , BM 26 , BM 28 , BM 33 , BM 34 , BM 37 , BM 38 , BM 39 , BM 40 , BM 41 , BM 43 , BM 44 , BM 45 , BM 46 , BM 47 , BM 48 , BM 49 , BM 50 , BM 51 , BM 52 , BM 53 , BM 54 , BM 55 , BM 61 , BM 62 , BM 63 , BM 64 , BM 65 , BM 66 , BM 91 , BM 92 , BM 96 , BM 97 DEPOSITED MATERIAL : BM 54 ,
21.08. 2006
., 2 spec. (PMR- 17648 ).

Chaetozone gibber Woodham & Chambers, 1994
DISTRIBUTION : NA , CA.

LITERATURE
RECORDS
:
Castelli et al . 2008
;
La Porta et al . 2011
.
NEW
RECORDS
: BM 53 , BM 54 .

REMARKS : Uncertain presence in the Mediterranean. All Mediterranean records of
C. setosa
should be reexamined as they could belong to
C. carpenteri McIntosh, 1911
, recently recorded in the Adriatic and the Tyrrhenian Sea (
Chambers et al. 2011
) or to
C. gibber Woodham & Chambers, 1994 (
Castelli et al. 2008
)
. For the purposes of this research it was not possible to re-examine specimens of
C. setosa
previously reported in the literature for the Adriatic Sea in order to assign them to the one of the above mentioned species, so they currently remain as
C. setosa
.
